Posts.Content: Hi Tugs, Yes Lipitor is known to give muscle and joint pains pls talk to your dr. asap. good luck..... Annie S. Long Island NY <3
Posts.Title: Taxotere Joint Pain

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, I send hugs and blessings to all of us who are BC sisters. I will be done with my chemo on June 6, 2005 YIPEE -(12 consecutive taxols prior was 4/A/C dose dense)and have had a visit with a reconstructive plastic surgeon to see if I would be a candidate for implants or what my options can be. I still need to complete 35 rounds of radiation yet, but I am forever researching my options. What a shame to find out that I was not told of the microvascular damages that the rads. do to your lungs, heart, etc. and since I had chose a lumpectomy (recommended to me by breast surgeon) that my chances of infection due to microvascular and germs left behind are high for implant. Ofcourse I want my "girls" to be as perfect as can be, but now I see I have maybe three choices. #1. Implant, and very possible infection maybe treated with antibiotics, and or removal of implant and try again. #2. Mastectomy with implant and NO chance(or minute) of recurring cancer to that breast. #3. See how the lump. breast looks after rads. and have healthy breast lifted and reduced to match rad. breast. I certainly now wish that a BC person or my own doctors would have expressed the whole line of "what if's" down to the final stage before I chose to have lumpectomy. Seem's the damages of rads. is and will continue to be thru-out my life cycle. And all microvascular. (Inside) So what am I looking for? Anyone with information of what they choose from lumpectomy stand point. And what it took to get them there. The doctor I saw is an artist in her work, but has caustioned me that implants with lump. do pose a higher risk of infection. Also I am not looking to become Dolly Parton lol, I just want the "look of cancer" gone and feel femimine again. Now I am a loose 36C (lol) who knows what the lump. breast will be when done with rads. maybe a firmer B - sure wouldn't mind being a small D since I am 5'10" and after dieting and excersise I will be back to my 160 lbs.-now 171 lbs. So ladies??? What have you done? I appreciate any information. And if you've gotten this far, GOD BLESS ya's!!! God bless all. Peace, happiness, hugs and continue to let the sunshine in!!! Annie S. L.I. NY 50 yrs old. Stage IIA 3 cm Tumor Invasive Ductual Carsinoma Lumpectomy 12-1-04 4 A/C 1-10-05/2-21-05 dose dense 12 consectutive weekly Taxol's (one to go 6-6-05) 35 rads. to go, start 7-5-05 ER-, PR- and HER2NEU- Can not take tomox. or other cancer fighters for the next 5 yrs. because of above stats, so went extremely agressive with chemo's. Also sorry for spelling :o). <3
Posts.Title: radiation and breast implants

Posts.Content: Hi ladies, I too am on taxol, finished A/C dose dense, no problems, now finished 9 treatments of Taxol, 3 more to go. Yes bone pain is in the flat and or long bones, I take tylenol xtra strength to get me thru it. Normally hits me with extreme fatigue 3 -5 days after treatment. I get taxol on mondays weekly. 12 in a row. By thurs. I am fatigued, and feel sharp pinching bone pains spasam thru the inner inside of my bones Hmmmm does it feel like that to you too? Strange stuff huh. I also get it in my ears (like swim ear) face bones sometimes hurt too. But it hits fast and leaves fast too. Get massages, from pro, or hubby or kids or girl friends. Rub and massage ur hands and feet as much as poosible for the numbness associated problems. Keep them stimulated. DRINK ALOT of water ALWAYS. Keep very hydrated. Good luck ladies, if anyone wants to email me I am [email protected], feel free to pick my brain :o) Love Peace and hugs, Annie S Long Island NY 50 yrs. old ER, PR - HER2NEU - 3 cm tumor, lumpectomy Dec.. 1, 2004 A/C dose dense 1-10-05 thru 2-21-05 Taxol 12 consecutive treatments weekly. 3 Neulasta w/ A/c Teatments 1 Neulasta treatment which put me into 90.9 wbc off the charts severe bone pain 4 days. 3 nodes removed all clean Breast tissue margins were clear Lots of chemo for all that huh? 2nd opinion Memorial Sloan Kettering Hosp. my oncol. at home said 4 taxol Sloan said 12 consectutive. took sloans advice...... Good luck all!! God bless
Posts.Title: Taxotere Joint Pain

Posts.Content: Hello, I've recently been told that I'm a good candidate for Mammosite treatment after a diagnosis and breast conservation surgery and lymph node disection for of Ductal Carcinoma In Situ, two small lesions, non hormone receptive. Will anyone who has had MammoSite treatment please post an update? Annie Online
Posts.Title: Anyone Have Mammosite Radiation with Balloon Catheter

Posts.Content: I am responding to Andee's question which was written a year ago because I have just learned about MammoSite and have been told that I am a good candidate for it. Has anyone else had a Mammosite experience that could help provide more information? Thanks, Annie Originally Posted by Andee Would like to know if anyone actually had Mammosite radiation with balloon catheter. I am scheduled to have the catheter inserted next Tuesday, 10/26 and would like to know how it felt right after. Pain, etc. I am also having a port put in on the other side at the same time, even though I am still not too sure about having chemo, I wanted it all done at one time instead of having to go back to have the port put in at a different time. I'm a glutton for punishment. Four weeks after lumpectomy and SNB and I am still in a lot of pain from that and now I'm going to have two more incisions. Anyway, really would like to know about the mammosite. Andee
Posts.Title: Anyone Have Mammosite Radiation with Balloon Catheter

Posts.Content: Hello, I would like to learn about MammoSite experience from anyone who has "been there, done that." I am post-surgery breast conservation and lymph node disection and understand that I am a "good" candidate for the MammoSite treatment. All info appreciated. Annie Online
Posts.Title: MammoSite Update

Posts.Content: Is anyone out there who is willing to share Mammosite info asap? I am 64, 1 DCI very small, 1 Infiltrated DCI less that 1 cm, Stage I, no involved lymphs, post BC surgery with good margins. I understand that I am a good candidate for MammoSite treatment and would like more information from "those who know" or have had personal experience. Thanks so much for a prompt reply. Annie Online
Posts.Title: MammoSite Info Please

Posts.Content: Hello, I'm worried about the difficulty of coping with the catheter, the level of pain and possibility of radiation burn, and radiation exposure to other areas of my body. I've read the MammoSite literature which makes it all sound very easy, but when the medical personnel tell me that it has never happened to their patients, the truth is they have had very few patients. My reason for considering the MammoSite treatment is that I understand that a smaller area is radiated and that there are less side effects from the radiation, i.e. heart and lung damage, than when the whole breast radiation, and less damage to skin and tissue. Does that theory hold up in real time experience?? Thanks for any info. Annie Online
Posts.Title: MammoSite Info Please

Posts.Content: Hello, I am interested in knowing if any other women who have Breast Cancer and are HER2NEU positive have taken Taxol or any type's of chemo for their BC. I am also estrogen receptor negative and progesteron receptor negative, my BC was not involved with lymph knodes and margins were clear. If anyone out there has similiar or same, please contact me. [email protected]. My doctor would lik eme to do the Taxene;s but there is not much information on women who are HER2NEU positive on this type of chemo. I apprecaite any help on this subject. Thank you Annie <3
Posts.Title: HER2NEU positive and Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: First thank you all for your responses to my questions of HER2NEU. Second I must let you all know that I had called my Radiation Oncologist to let him know that my onco. wanted me to take Taxol (Taxenes) because as he had told me I was NER2NEU Post., well my Rad. Oncol. said he was looking at my reports and I am NOT POSTITVE but I am Negative. SHOCK. He was to call my oncol. to make sure he had the same paperwork and to ask what he had stating that I was Postitive. So now here is the next line of questions since I am so totally confused!! My stats are as follows: Infiltrated Ductual Carsinoma ER-, PR-, Her2-, Ki-67 60% (? I have no clue as to what that is) No Nodes were involved, margins clean, lumpectomy 3cm with 3 cm of clean tissue. I am 50 yrs. old Sentinal Node Biop. (3 nodes all clean), Premenapausal. I have three sessions of Adromyicin & Cytoxin w/Krtril (Alozi), Decadron, Ativan & Emend. I continue with Emend days 2 3 & 4 2 x's daily. Warafin (Blood thinner) daily. I am on Dose Dense of every 14 days. So now the burning question of ISN'T this ENOUGH treatment yet? Or is Taxol still necessary? Thank you all again - Many Many HUGS :)) Annie S[/i]
